docs.title: Adobe Animate Scripting Guide
docs.text:
Welcome to the Adobe Animate Scripting Guide!

This is a living document, and is constantly being updated and edited. The latest public version of the SDK is available at: https://www.adobe.io/apis/creativecloud/animate.html

While we've tried to organize this document in a logical order and provide plenty of cross references, your specific needs may vary. Searching through this document based on keywords will often lead you to your answer.

If you need more information, your question may already be answered on the Animate forum: Animate Forum

Use the search box there, and post a new question if your question hasn't already been answered.

docs.title: Contribution
docs.text: This endeavour is primarily community-supported & run; contributors are welcome and encouraged to suggest fixes, adjustments, notes/warnings, and anything else that may help the project.

docs.title: Licensing & Ownership
docs.text:
This project exists for educational purposes only.

All content is copyright Adobe Systems Incorporated.

docs.title: docsforadobe.dev MkDocs Config
docs.text:
This repo holds the common components shared between this org's hosted MkDocs documentation projects.

The idea is that this repo will be kept up-to-date with global config, and each child repo will use the provided script to download the latest commit from this repo, and have its "local" MkDocs config point to the downloaded files from this repo.

In all cases, each child repo will be able to override config items here as needed.

docs.title: Updating This Repo
docs.text: See Modifying Common Components in the org contribution guide for info on how this repo works, and best practices for modifying it.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Provides access to objects and application settings within Animate.

The single global object is always available by its name, app, an, animate, flash, or fl.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Provides access to objects and document settings within Animate.

The single global object is always available by its name, document.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Is the global object in Animate, providing access to other core features including:

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description app an animate flash fl Application object Current application document Document object Active document
